title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict produces clean, publication-ready tables redistricting analysis. designed accompany maps redist related packages, summarizing district-level data population, demographics, elections, compactness, contiguity, administrative splits. package builds two core R table libraries: gt formatted HTML output tibble data-frame output (set as_gt = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict ships two example datasets West Virginia: wv: redist_map object county-level demographic, partisan, geographic data wv_plans: redist_plans object sampled redistricting plans enacted 2020 congressional plan

title: Getting Started with rict
text: simplest entry point rict(), creates summary table redist_map redist_plans object: redist_plans object, specify plan display:
code: rict(wv) #> Warning: There was 1 warning in `dplyr::summarize()`. #> ℹ In argument: `dplyr::across(where(is.numeric), sum, na.rm = TRUE)`. #> ℹ In group 1: `district = 1`. #> Caused by warning: #> ! The `...` argument of `across()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.1.0. #> Supply arguments directly to `.fns` through an anonymous function instead. #>  #>   # Previously #>   across(a:b, mean, na.rm = TRUE) #>  #>   # Now #>   across(a:b, \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)) #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the redist package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/alarm-redist/redist/issues>. rict(wv_plans, "cd_2020")

title: Getting Started with rict
text: targeted analysis, use rict_* family functions. accepts map plan argument, returns either gt table (default) tibble.

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_population() shows total population per district deviation ideal (equal) population:

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_demographics() breaks population voting-age population (VAP) race ethnicity. default, subcategory columns normalized proportions: Set normalize = FALSE see raw counts:
code: rict_demographics(map = wv, plan = wv$cd_2020) rict_demographics(map = wv, plan = wv$cd_2020, normalize = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_elections() summarizes partisan election data. automatically detects individual contest columns (e.g., pre_20_dem_bid), cycle-average columns (adv_20, arv_20), normal vote columns (ndv, nrv), computing Democratic vote share :

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_compactness() computes geometric compactness measures via redistmetrics. default measures Polsby-Popper, Schwartzberg, Reock, Convex Hull: can supply custom measures named list functions:
code: rict_compactness(map = wv, plan = wv$cd_2020) rict_compactness(   map = wv, plan = wv$cd_2020,   measures = list(     "comp_polsby" = redistmetrics::comp_polsby,     "comp_lw" = redistmetrics::comp_lw   ) )

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_contiguity() checks many connected pieces district :

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_splits() counts administrative boundaries (e.g., counties, states) split across districts:

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict_component() breaks population administrative unit within district:

what: Getting tibbles instead of gt tables
title: Getting Started with rict
text: Every rict_* function accepts as_gt = FALSE return tibble instead gt table, making easy use results computation:
code: rict_elections(map = wv, plan = wv$cd_2020, as_gt = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   District ndshare pre_20 avg_20 #>      <int>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1        1   0.292  0.292  0.292 #> 2        2   0.312  0.312  0.312

title: Getting Started with rict
text: rict provides several helpers working gt tables:

title: Getting Started with rict
text: data_color_party() applies red--blue color scale Democratic vote share columns:

title: Getting Started with rict
text: gt_plot_sf() embeds small maps sf geometries gt table:
code: wv_dist <- wv |> dplyr::group_by(cd_2020) |> dplyr::summarize() gt::gt(wv_dist) |> gt_plot_sf()

title: Getting Started with rict
text: gt_plot_compactness() adds visual compactness overlays (e.g., equal-area circles, convex hulls) table compactness metrics:

title: Getting Started with rict
text: gt_add_column(): add new column gt table gt_get_data(): extract underlying tibble gt table gt_hide_lists(): hide list-columns (e.g., adjacency lists) display
code: tab <- rict(wv) gt_get_data(tab) #> # A tibble: 2 × 40 #>   district    pop pop_white pop_black pop_hisp pop_aian pop_asian pop_nhpi #>      <int>  <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1        1 896067    805369     36345    11331     1632      6132      155 #> 2        2 897649    793465     28404    23496     1555      8771      274 #> # ℹ 32 more variables: pop_other <dbl>, pop_two <dbl>, vap <dbl>, #> #   vap_white <dbl>, vap_black <dbl>, vap_hisp <dbl>, vap_aian <dbl>, #> #   vap_asian <dbl>, vap_nhpi <dbl>, vap_other <dbl>, vap_two <dbl>, #> #   cd_2010 <int>, cd_2020 <int>, pre_20_rep_tru <dbl>, pre_20_dem_bid <dbl>, #> #   ndv <dbl>, adv_20 <dbl>, nrv <dbl>, arv_20 <dbl>, sample_1 <int>, #> #   sample_2 <int>, sample_3 <int>, sample_4 <int>, sample_5 <int>, #> #   sample_6 <int>, sample_7 <int>, sample_8 <int>, sample_9 <int>, …

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christopher T. Kenny. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2026). rict: Redistricting Clean Tables. R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://christophertkenny.com/rict/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rict: Redistricting in Clean Tables},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://christophertkenny.com/rict/}, }

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: rict provides clean, formatted gt tables accompany redistricting maps. designed complement redist redistmetrics, works electoral demographic data.

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: can install development version rict GitHub :

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: rict provides family rict_*() functions, producing formatted table specific redistricting quantity: Additional helpers embed visuals directly inside gt table:

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: rict_demographics() summarizes total population voting-age population race/ethnicity across districts.

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: rict_compactness() tabulates common geometric compactness scores district.

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: rict_elections() shows Democratic vote shares electoral contest, along normal partisan averages.

title: Redistricting in Clean Tables
text: redist_plans object, rict() formats single draw table.

The `...` argument of `across()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.1.0. #> Supply arguments directly to `.fns` through an anonymous function instead. #>  #>   # Previously #>   across(a:b, mean, na.rm = TRUE) #>  #>   # Now #>   across(a:b, \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)) #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the redist package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/alarm-redist/redist/issues>.     district       pop       pop_white       pop_black       pop_hisp       pop_aian       pop_asian       pop_nhpi       pop_other       pop_two       vap       vap_white       vap_black       vap_hisp       vap_aian       vap_asian       vap_nhpi       vap_other       vap_two       cd_2010       cd_2020       pre_20_rep_tru       pre_20_dem_bid       ndv       adv_20       nrv       arv_20       sample_1       sample_2       sample_3       sample_4       sample_5       sample_6       sample_7       sample_8       sample_9       sample_10       sample_11       sample_12       state       r     1 896067 805369 36345 11331 1632 6132 155 2136 32967 715682 649695 29039 7866 1426 5030 116 1294 21216 73 28 273523 112947 112947 112947 273523 273523 37 31 36 35 38 33 35 36 31 31 37 36 WV 32 897649 793465 28404 23496 1555 8771 274 2516 39168 717250 643345 22963 15617 1335 7203 217 1687 24883 35 54 271859 123037 123037 123037 271859 271859 52 53 50 53 51 51 53 53 53 52 51 53 WV 3

title: Add Compactness Metric Plots to a gt — gt_plot_compactness
text: tab gt table class gt_tbl shp sf object plan numeric vector one entry precinct shp. measures character vector indicating measures plot. Uses guess_comp() supplied. height height, pixels, image. Default 200. ... additional arguments. currently passed .

title: Create Plots for Common Compactness Metrics — plot_compactness
code: plot_compactness(   shp,   plan,   measure = c("Polsby Popper", "Schwartzberg", "Reock", "Convex Hull", "Length Width",     "Skew", "Box Reock"),   fill_color = "deeppink" )

title: Create Plots for Common Compactness Metrics — plot_compactness
text: shp sf object plan numeric vector one entry precinct shp. measure character indicating measure plot. Default 'Polsby Popper'. fill_color hex color name fill shape. second entry can provided fill background.

what: rict: Redistricting in Clean Tables — rict-package
title: rict: Redistricting in Clean Tables — rict-package
text: Provides suite tools create tables accompany maps. focus clean, informative tables electoral outcomes, compactness, district-level quantities. tools aimed redistricting context, broadly applicable electoral data.

title: rict: Redistricting in Clean Tables — rict-package
text: Maintainer: Christopher T. Kenny ctkenny@proton.(ORCID)

what: Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
title: Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
text: Creates formatted gt::gt table summarizing redistricting plans maps.

title: Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
text: x redist_map redist_plans object. plan redist_plans: draw name number display. redist_map: column vector district assignments (defaults existing plan via redist::get_existing()). ... Additional arguments passed methods.

title: Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
text: gt::gt table

title: Create a Summary Table from Redistricting Data — rict
code: data(wv_plans) rict(wv)     district       pop       pop_white       pop_black       pop_hisp       pop_aian       pop_asian       pop_nhpi       pop_other       pop_two       vap       vap_white       vap_black       vap_hisp       vap_aian       vap_asian       vap_nhpi       vap_other       vap_two       cd_2010       cd_2020       pre_20_rep_tru       pre_20_dem_bid       ndv       adv_20       nrv       arv_20       sample_1       sample_2       sample_3       sample_4       sample_5       sample_6       sample_7       sample_8       sample_9       sample_10       sample_11       sample_12       state     1 896067 805369 36345 11331 1632 6132 155 2136 32967 715682 649695 29039 7866 1426 5030 116 1294 21216 73 28 273523 112947 112947 112947 273523 273523 37 31 36 35 38 33 35 36 31 31 37 36 WV2 897649 793465 28404 23496 1555 8771 274 2516 39168 717250 643345 22963 15617 1335 7203 217 1687 24883 35 54 271859 123037 123037 123037 271859 271859 52 53 50 53 51 51 53 53 53 52 51 53 WV

Default: TRUE.

title: West Virginia Geographic Data — wv
